name: Dunes Village Resort

reviews.title: Wish we were back already!
reviews.text: We stayed at Dunes Village from September 16-20th. We had a great time. We have stayed there before but it is only getting better.

The service was great, the room on the 8th floor was wonderful, the view was beautiful. We enjoyed all of the pools and waterpark. The only thing I noticed was at the hot tubs people should not be sitting on the steps or letting their kids sit on the steps. People were having a hard time getting in and out of the tubs because of that. But we can not wait to return.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Just got back from a 3 night stay here. We had a great time!! We loved the water park and beach access. Our room was wonderful and we had a great view of the beach from the balcony. We will be back.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Dunes Village and we loved everything about this place. Our rooms were very nice and had amazing views of the ocean. The staff was wonderful as well.
reviews.title: Fun fun fun!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definatly be back!!
reviews.title: Never Again

likes.disliked: — The staff's response to all the problems I encountered in two day.

reviews.text: Just got back for one week + at the Dunes Village. Second visit here but first review on TA.
reviews.title: Another Great Week at Dunes Village!

reviews.text: Last time we got a 2 bedroom OF deluxe in the Palms Tower, this time a 2 bedroom Angle OF room in the Palmetto Tower. Both rooms were great...lots of space, everything worked well and great value for the money. I dont know too many places where you can get an 2 bedroom Condo in Oceanfront Hotel for what you get and what you pay at Dunes Village. The location is also excellent....right in the middle of the north end of the strip in a nice residential area, and close to everything.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: Our kids are older so they did not really take advantage of all of the water park amenities, but if you have young kids how can you go wrong with such a great beach and waterpark at your fingertips? I imagine most little people sleep very very well after a sunny warm day at this resort.They seemed to have lots of kids activities even though we weren't there in prime summer season.
reviews.title: Rooms and Food great, pools and security need help

reviews.text: For those who have never been to Myrtle Beach, we having been coming down from Canada for over 20 years and I cant say enough about this place - great beach, great climate, many good beachfront hotels of which the Dunes is one of the best, many good restaurants, excellent affordable golf and good shopping. Other than all that, the place is terrible :)
reviews.title: Amazing hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting back to the Resort, the front desk service is excellent. There is also a great Seattle's Best Coffee shop in the Palmetto Tower. The blonde lady there (forget her name) gave me exactly what I needed early in the morning before heading off to the golf course...a friendly smile, great service and really good hot cup of coffee!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay. Many, many things to do especially with your kids but even if you go without them there are many things to do for adults as well. Loved the play ground, water parks (which we got to play in together) loved the beach. The resort restaurants were excellent, really no need to go out anywhere else.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!!!

reviews.text: This is a fantastic place to stay. The rooms are spacious, clean, well-maintained, and the view was so delightful. The restaurants serve delicious food at a very reasonable price. There is plenty of convenient parking. I saw lots of delighted children because there was plenty of things for them to do at the hotel. I have stayed here several times and will stay here again when I return to Myrtle Beach.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Room was clean and comfortable and quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Never had to wait for an elevator. Parking is convenient. There are lots of activities geared toward children, and there were lots of happy kids. But folks looking for a peaceful vacation shouldn't be deterred by the "family" atmosphere, at least not during the school year. It's probably very different in the summer, but in the fall it was restful. The view from our oceanfront balcony was amazing. Highly recommend this resort. We'll definitely go back.
reviews.title: Not just for kids!

reviews.text: One tip - When you go to Myrtle Beach, pack your own beach chairs and umbrella - $30/day is pretty high for rentals.
reviews.title: grand-daughters' treat!!!

reviews.text: This was a wonderful short stay in Myrtle Beach. We arrived for a 3 day weekend in May of 2012. This hotel has everything for kids, and this may i add made the grand-parents job a little easier. Our little girl is 10, and she loved all the slides, the lazy river, the room, she was a very happy little girl. We were so impressed....we are planning another stay!!!!
reviews.title: Great family getaway!

reviews.text: We stayed at Dunes Village resort the week of Sept. 6th. We got to the hotel at 2pm and our room was ready and check in was a breeze. There were 3 young people working the desk looking a bit under enthused to be there: playing with cells phones and chatting but the one girl that check us was pleasant.
reviews.title: Great stay at Dunes Village Resort

reviews.text: Our room was clean, unlike other reviewer’s experiences, and very nicely decorated. We were in the "older" building in a suite room 906.
reviews.title: A Terrific Hotel!

reviews.text: Housekeeping was OK and a bit inconsistent. Some days we got fresh dishtowels, some days we didn't, some times we got dish detergent, sometimes not...not a big deal really. Always plenty of soap and fresh bath towels. Some times they came early and a few times they were there when we got back to our room for lunch, one day we came back for lunch at 12:30 and the room wasn't done yet so we didn't bother to have them come that day. But really, when you leave your room at 9:30-10 and come back at 12:30, that isn't a big window for them, so we understood. One day they left our room open with the lock latch turned out, that was shock, but nothing happened but I suppose it could have.
reviews.title: Very nice for families with kids.

reviews.text: Pools were nice; our 3 year old LOVED the pool areas. LOTS of kids at this resort. If you have kids it’s great, always someone to play with; if you don't, you will probably feel a bit bombarded.
reviews.title: We loved Dunes Village

likes.liked: — Indoor water park, view from our room, and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Parking garage is not attached to the buidling

reviews.text: The lifeguards set up about 30 chairs and umbrellas for rent right across the front of your hotel pretty far back on the beach for rent. They will not allow you to put up your umbrella in front of theirs. I was aggravated and did a little research online; in Myrtle Beach, all umbrellas have to be set up 10' behind the lifeguard stand as to not black their view (lifeguards) of the ocean. This is a bit odd to me growing up on the Jersey shore where the whole beach is a “sea” of umbrellas. It wouldn't be so aggravating if the life guards didn't take up the hotels prime location with their rentals...if you want an umbrella you have to either set up behind them or on the sides...it's a pain plain and simple. Although, they didn’t enforce this till wed.
reviews.title: Love the Dunes! Won't stay anywhere else!

likes.liked: — The beautiful room, water park, and ocean!
likes.disliked: — Internet access requires Ethernet cord-but no biggie

reviews.text: Just returned home two days ago from a four-night stay at Dunes Village Resort. The hotel itself is very nice, as well as the employees. My room, which was a 2 Queen Oceanfront, was clean and comfortable. This was the first hotel I stayed at anywhere that had a jacuzzi tub and a washer/dryer set in the room (and they worked properly), so I considered that two exta bonus points. Breakfast at the Admirals Room was very good each day I was there. Ocean view from 14th story balcony was great. Parking garage across the street very secure.
reviews.title: Very nice resort.

reviews.text: I knew going in that this resort was very kid-friendly, and as I expected there were plenty of kids there, even despite it being a new school year in the off season. So for all the solo/couple/business travelers keep this in mind if being around lots of kids is an issue (not for me - sometimes LOL).
reviews.title: nice

reviews.text: Overall I had a very nice stay, and would not hesitate to recommend to others, especially those with children.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have stayed in in myrtle beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place to stay with a very friendly and a courteous staff. Does not get an excellent, a cold snap came just days before we arrived. The indoor play areas are only indoor when they put the glass in to inclose the areas other wise the cold night time air blows right thru the entire indoor pool, slide and play areas. They do not totally inclose the indoor play areas till next month November. In the newest tower all the pools, slides, lazy river are heated in the older tower (where we stayed) the water was not heated. we also stayed on the second floor with the hotel next door's pool house (pump) was at our window. If you go request a higher level room and a room with a balcony facing the north. We are already planning our trip again next year going back to the Dunes it was a very nice place very clean, and well maintained, with lots to do even on cold rainy days.
reviews.title: Myrtle Beach, SC

reviews.text: This hotel was nothing short of wonderful. I have two sons, ages 4 and 2, and they loved every minute. The rooms were very nice and clean. All the staff was friendly and willing to help in whatever means necessary. The pools, indoor and outdoor, were very clean and had plenty enough room to handle the large number of guests at the hotel and everyone have enough room to move around. The lines for the water slides weren't long at all, and the kiddie pools were perfect. There were great daily activities for the kids, along with numerous activities such as putt putt, a playground, super-sized chess and checkers, wii, ping pong, shuffle board, and more to keep the kids entertained. My family has found our vacation spot from now on, and may invest in a time share in the future. Really a wonderful place!!
reviews.title: Great getaway

reviews.text: ( I usually don't do reviews but due to some of the bad reviews, I felt the need to write one)
reviews.title: BEST RESORT in Myrtle Beach!!

likes.disliked: — Virgin Drink prices are HIGHER than the ones w/o liquor??!!

reviews.text: My Family and I stayed at the DUNES VILLAGE RESORT September 21st -26th and we LOVED our stay!!
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back

reviews.text: We arrived at the resort around 1:30 pm or so and thought that we would check and see if our room was ready. DONNA (she's great) @ the front desk checked and told me that our "room on the 9th floor wasn't ready" and I told her that" I was hoping to have a higher room".....after a few minutes she said "I have found you a room on the 12th floor, it's clean and ready to be checked into"!! I was so impressed with her.... VERY friendly and helpful! So Check In was a breeze!
reviews.title: Treated Like Royalty at the Luxurious Dunes Village Resort

reviews.text: Our room was 1206 in the Palmetto Building (newer building)... we had the Ocean Front, one bedroom queen suite which I HIGHLY recommend!! The room was VERY nice, very big and VERY CLEAN!! We had a concern with the murphey bed and I called the front desk..... no longer did I hang the phone up that the Cleaning Manager was knocking at my door and corrected the problem. The suite we stayed in had a large bedroom w/ two queen beds, TV and DVD player.... the bathroom was huge (very nice) w/ a whirl pool tub, Nice kitchen w/ everything that you need and livingroom w/ TV and DVD player. My husband I opted to sleep on the Murphey Bed and my 2 children (12 and 8) stayed in the bedroom. The Murphey Bed was actually very comfortable! BEST of all........... it had a Washer and Dryer which I used EVERYDAY!!! TOWELS W/O SAND YEA!!!
reviews.title: Great Stay at Dunes Village

likes.liked: — Beautiful room, waterparks, beach, pool bar
likes.disliked: — Outside hallways were a little hot and buggy.

reviews.title: Mostly pleasant stay at Dunes Village at Myrtle Beach
reviews.text: The WATERPARK.........what a lifesaver!! We have been going to Myrtle Beach off and on for 15 years or longer (first time @ the Dunes) and the weather this time was the worse that we have have seen there! Alot of wind... rain etc.! We stayed on the beach as long as we could and when the weather wasn't too bad and when it was bad we were in the waterpark! We all had a great time there....... the waterslides we all rode as well as the lazy river! We played ping-pong, pool, shuffel board and checkers. Our last day there, it rained all day and it was great to have the waterpark to still have a good time!

reviews.title: Best for families
reviews.text: This is the best place we've stayed at Myrtle or Wrightsville beaches. We will be back. That said, not everything is perfect. Here are pros and cons.
Pros:
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Fall Getaway at Dunes!

reviews.text: 1. Indoor water park-- we went off-season and on cloudy days you can still have lots of fun water time. Must also be true if it rains in the summer.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: 2. Friendly staff--everyone was nice and willing to help.
reviews.title: Family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Location--north of the main crowds, but still easy to get get to everything.
reviews.title: Wonderful place for families and couples

reviews.text: At first I was worried about booking this hotel, because of previous reviews saying housekeeping was poor. I am very big about my room being clean. I booked on the hotel website, and would loose money if I cancelled. I called the hotel about my concerns of housekeeping. Mangement assured the rooms would be clean. We had around 8 rooms booked and none of the families had a problem with housekeeping or the beds. The rooms are spacious and parking is not a problem. The front desk staff was friendly and pool area was an added plus. We had a full ocenview. In the angle rooms I visited, you did not get a great view of the ocean. I recommend going to the hotel website to see what specials they have on rooms.
reviews.title: A Whole Lot Better Than What I Thought

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at Dunes Village from October 1-5, 2008 in room 1031, Palms Tower. It was an Angle Oceanfront with 2 queens. Check-in went very smooth and the lady helping us explained things and was very nice. We did get lost trying to figure out which side to go up in to find out room but figured it out quickly and got to our room. The room was very nice and clean with a beautiful view. My boys slept in the murphy bed on the first night, then in the sleeper sofa and slept well on both. I have read reviews saying the beds were hard but we found them to be very comfortable! My parents came down for a few days and had a King Oceanfront room in the Palmetto Tower, which was also very clean and they slept real well on their bed.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!
Relax & Enjoy Dunes Village
reviews.text: Both towers had great housekeeping. We were there when the maid came by so she just asked if we needed anything and we gave her the trash or towels and she gave us back a nice stack of towels. One day we stayed we asked her to come back because we weren't ready for service when she came by. We came back to our room all clean. Just like the bed issue I don't see where housekeeping is bad at all either!
On that Saturday night there were 2 couples out front making a lot of noise and the security guard came out, then they were gone a few minutes later.
reviews.title: loved dunes village resort

reviews.text: The Palms Tower water area was not open for most of the time we were there because of construction. They did open it on Saturday in limited use. They have a lazy river, then a large hot tub, pool and 2 more hot tubs which was all very nice! There's also a tall slide but it was not open. Palmetto Tower has a long lazy river, couple hot tubs and 2 slides. We enjoyed all of it very much. You do have to be careful on Friday and Saturday nights when it gets busier and teens/older kids are playing in there. Some of them were getting a little wild and we got concerned about the smaller children. I do think if you complained the hotel would have people in there to calm it all down.
reviews.title: Average

likes.liked: — Huge rooms with lots of space
likes.disliked: — Bad view for upgraded room; the garage across the street

description: Chosen as one of the WORLD'S top 1% of Hotels by Expedia Insider's Select 2008 and Voted #2 in Family Hotels in the UNITED STATES by Travelers Choice Awards, Dunes Village is home of the area’s only indoor water parks; 30,000 square feet of water fun! 4 adult-size waterslides, water basketball, lazy rivers, kiddie pools, mushroom waterfalls and the list goes on. Tennis buffs stay limber on the tennis court and basketball fans shoot hoops on the basketball court. Children enjoy the year-round supervised activity program, giving parents an opportunity to sit back and relax knowing the kiddies are having fun of their own. Dine in one of the 2 onsite restaurants or sip a cup of coffee from Seattle’s Best Coffee. At the end of the day, our spacious studios, suites and condos are the perfect ending to a great day at this award winning resort.
